document.discussion_title: Thomas Alleyne's High School recognised by national education body | Uttoxeter Advertiser
document.topic_text: Thomas Alleyne's High School recognised by national education body By Uttoxeter Advertiser | Posted: April 25, 2016 By Richard Castle ALLEYNE'S head teacher Julie Rudge is delighted to have received national recognition for improved exam results and pupil progress. VIEW GALLERY Thomas Alleyne's High School recognised by national education body X Copy link to paste in your message / ALLEYNE'S head teacher Julie Rudge is delighted to have received national recognition for improved exam results and... ALLEYNE'S head teacher Julie Rudge is delighted to have received national recognition for improved exam results and... FELICITY Roe and Hettie Phillips-Marsh were among those celebrating brilliant GCSE results at Alleyne's in 2015. THIS picture shows Lucy Ormiston-Lee and Megan Jones picking up their results in August 2015. GABRIELLA Bepole, James Freeman and Rhona Gardner were among those who excelled int heir 2015 GCSEs.
